SENT.plain: Antiphospholipid antibodies have been associated with an increased risk of thromboses, most of which occur in veins
We observed a very unusual association of cerebral and renal thromboses, in 2 patients with systemic lupus and anti-prothrombinase, in whom arterial occlusions were clearly documented
Immunosuppressive treatment was followed by a dramatic improvement in both
In the literature, no treatment clearly prevents the recurrence of these thromboses
This could be partly explained by our current ignorance of their pathogeny
